body:
context: https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/issues/10015

* Build URL (the latest successful build): https://readthedocs.org/projects/cython/builds/19395633/
* Build URL (the first failed build): https://readthedocs.org/projects/cython/builds/19423261/

It seems that the build failed because latexmk failed to build pdf.

comment_data.body: FWIW, NumPy decided to stop building official PDF docs since it is too much maintenance work.
I didn't even know we built a pdf version. So I wouldn't miss it if we didn't!

pdf and epub are additionally build be default
readthedocs reccommends to add `.readthedocs.yaml` and there all of the build formats can be specified
SEE: https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/config-file/v2.html#formats

for exmple here is configuration for one of my projects:
```
# .readthedocs.yaml
# Read the Docs configuration file
# See https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/config-file/v2.html for details

# Required
version: 2

# Set the versions of the tools
build:
  os: ubuntu-20.04
  tools:
    python: "3.11"

python:
  install:
    - requirements: requirements.txt
    - method: setuptools  # runs setup.py
      path: .
  system_packages: true

sphinx:
  builder: html
  configuration: docs/conf.py

# Build the docs in additional formats
formats:
  - pdf
```

if need be, i can make a pr for this

Is this stopping updated documentation from appearing? If so then please make a PR, I'll merge it, and we can decide later if we want to bother to fix it.

If it isn't stopping updated documentation from appearing then we should wait for @scoder before dropping them.

> Is this stopping updated documentation from appearing? 

Yes, it is. It seems to be an "accident" that the latexmk failure didn't block the documentation build in the past year, so we didn't even notice it.

After #5254 it still fails: https://readthedocs.org/projects/cython/builds/19543927/

Dependencies locked in docs-requirements.txt are too old, upgrading them can fix it:

``` shell
pip install -r docs-requirements.txt
pip install --upgrade $(pip list | awk 'NR > 2 {print $1}')
```
Right ... I've updated doc-requirements.txt in https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/9b5a89155ad2f3403b219d4d398c2c597fe9500c. We'll see how this does
That looks better. Thanks for your help.

Thanks!

Unfortunately, there are 2 more problems.

1. Two CSS are missing, compare https://web.archive.org/web/20230209061059/https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ with https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ :

``` html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="/web/20230209061059cs_/https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_static/pygments.css" type="text/css"/>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="/web/20230209061059cs_/https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_static/nature.css" type="text/css"/>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="/web/20230209061059cs_/https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_static/css/tabs.css" type="text/css"/>
```

``` html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="_static/css/tabs.css" type="text/css" />
```

Patching HTML locally can make the documentation looks normal, but unfortunately I'm not familiar with sphinx, don't know how to fix it.

2. CI is failing on Python 3.7: https://github.com/cython/cython/actions/runs/4230669687/jobs/7348267649#step:5:295

If we only build the docs on Python 3.11, we can just skip it on Python 3.7 - 3.10. BTW, should we use [pip-tools](https://github.com/jazzband/pip-tools) on docs-requirements.txt? [It suggests](https://pip-tools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#cross-environment-usage-of-requirements-in-requirements-txt-and-pip-compile) to use [PEP 508 environment markers](https://peps.python.org/pep-0508/#environment-markers) for the generated requirements.txt, which can avoid this problem.

> 2\. CI is failing on Python 3.7:

I would guess the the source of the problem is pinned max python version for sphinx, but I'm not 100% sure

Anyways it's the problem of the requirements file and not the building system, for users who wants to build docs on python 3.7 thay can fix it by themselves, so I think we should build the docs only on the latest python version

> Right ... I've updated doc-requirements.txt in [9b5a891](https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/9b5a89155ad2f3403b219d4d398c2c597fe9500c). We'll see how this does

but i still would recommend to use the sphinx <=5, it's available on more python version, including 3.7 and from the personal use appears to be supported by a greater number of libraries

actually i think it would be even better to just update the important requirement that caused the problem and not touch anything else, you know the saying, don't touch it if it works, I suspect that the version update caused the css problem

> FWIW, CPython is using sphinx 4.5.0

nice, that you mentioned that. I looked at what sphinx version I use in my biggest sphinx project and it's 4.5 too
and it was specifically pinned because of some compatibility problems that occured

Right - I've restored the css formatting. It remains to be seen if the CI is passing, but hopefully.

I'd quite like to avoiding compiling Cython on readthedocs (and just use `no-cython-compile` install), but I can't immediately see how to do that.

Hopefully we never need to touch it again

title: [DOCS] documentation build fails on readthedocs.org
